info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:28AM EDT until July 01 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 AM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN VIGO...NORTHERN CLAY AND SOUTHEASTERN PARKE COUNTIES... At 128 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Brazil, or 18 miles east of Terre Haute, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Brazil, Rockville, Seelyville, Knightsville, Harmony, Staunton, Carbon, Center Point, Fontanet, Bridgeton, Lena and Cecil Harden Lake. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 14 and 29. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
